newsitem.title: TURKEY: Turkey's Ciller says coalition to continue.
newsitem.headline: Turkey's Ciller says coalition to continue.

text.p: Turkey's Deputy Prime Minister Tansu Ciller said on Monday her coalition with Islamists would continue despite a row over the role of Islam in public life since the alliance came to power.
"We will continue to work with stability," Ciller told reporters after meeting Islamist Prime Minister Necmettin Erbakan.
Two ministers from Ciller's True Path Party (DYP) resigned at the weekend as a result of Erbakan's reluctance to meet military demands for a crackdown on Islamist activism.

He signed a communique by the military-dominated National Security Council on Saturday agreeing to go ahead with measures including the extension of secularist education at the expense of religious schools.
But Erbakan's Islam-based Welfare Party, afraid of losing grassroots support, is expected to oppose the education changes in parliament.
Ciller and Erbakan formed a coalition last June after the failure of a secularist right-wing coalition.
